titleStmt.title: A perambulatory word to court, camp, city and country: or, An arrow shot at randome, to teach some, and to reach others, but to ruine none, save such as are resolved to ruine all to set up one

publicationStmt.publisher: printed by J.C. for L. Chapman,

notesStmt.note: In defence of the Good Old Cause.
Reproductions of the originals in the British Library (Thomason Tracts), and the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery (Early English books, 1641-1700).
